response.body: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' standalone='no'?><xs:schema xmlns:hl7='urn:hl7-org:v3' xmlns='urn:npfit:psisqr' xmlns:xs='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema' targetNamespace='urn:npfit:psisqr' elementFormDefault='qualified'><xs:import namespace='urn:hl7-org:v3' schemaLocation='../dt/datatypes.xsd'/><xs:import namespace='urn:hl7-org:v3' schemaLocation='../../../voc/voc.xsd'/><xs:element name='queryResponseEventList'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>queryResponseEventList is the root element of the response for a 'get case summary' request. For event list, it will contain one-to-many events.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:complexType><xs:sequence><xs:element name='recordTarget' type='recordTarget'/><xs:element name='event' type='event' maxOccurs='unbounded'/></xs:sequence></xs:complexType></xs:element><xs:complexType name='recordTarget'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The recordTarget structure within the PSIS namespace mirrors the recordTarget/patient/id structure within HL7.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:sequence><xs:element name='patient' type='patient'/></xs:sequence></xs:complexType><xs:complexType name='patient'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>This patient element and the id within it represent the NHS number of the patient. The id is of type II-IE (Identifier External), so it has a root attribute and an extension attribute (the NHS number itself)</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:sequence><xs:element name='id' type='hl7:II'/></xs:sequence></xs:complexType><xs:complexType name='event'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The event element wraps an individual event.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:sequence maxOccurs='unbounded'><xs:element name='eventID' type='hl7:II'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>56B4CC1C-CEEA-46E5-EDGD-EAE15D7F7197</xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='withdrawingEventID' type='hl7:II' minOccurs='0'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>ID of the Event (if any) which withdrew this Event. It's of type II-IG (Identifier Global) so it has a root attribute that is the ID, and no other attributes.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='payloadID' type='hl7:II'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The artifact identifier of the payload - ie the type of message that was used to enter the event into PSIS (such as a GP Summary). This can be used to determine which schema is appropriate for validating the event data contained with the hl7Data element below. This is not the same as the event type - there may be a number of event types all associated with a single payload identifier.The payload identifier is of type II and has a root attribute that is the OID 2.16.840.1.113883.2.1.3.2.4.12 and an extension attribute that is the payload identifier (eg REPC_MT400101UK06)</xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='persistenceDate' type='psisDate'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The date at which the event was entered into PSIS, in yyyyMMddhhmmss format. This does not necessarily correspond to the date on which the event occurred. This is an HL7 timestamp field, which can have a number of different formats, but PSIS will only use the form that has a value attribute containing a date in the format yyyyMMddhhmmss.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='eventStatus' type='psisDataStatus'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The current status of the event - see the further comments below.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='eventType' type='hl7:CV'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The type of the event. This is a CV-CP field (Coded Value-Coded Plain), that will have attributes of codeSystem, code, and displayName. The code is extracted from the original HL7 event using the XPath */code/@code. The displayName is the name that is registered within PSIS for the event type. </xs:documentation></xs:annotation></xs:element><xs:element name='author' type='author' minOccurs='0'/></xs:sequence></xs:complexType><xs:complexType name='author'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The author element contains HL7 that represents the author of the document; either an individual or an organization. This is a chunk of HL7 data in the HL7 namespace that has been extracted by PSIS from the focal act of the event. Although it is not constrained by the schema, this should either be an  R_AgentNPFITOrgSDS (UKCT_MT120501UK02) or a R_AgentNPFITPersonSDS (UKCT_RM120301UK02).</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:sequence><xs:any namespace='##any' processContents='lax'/></xs:sequence></xs:complexType><xs:complexType name='psisDataStatus'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>This is a CV-CP field (Coded Value-Coded Plain), that will have attributes of codeSystem, code, and displayName. The codeSystem OID will always be the same, and refers to the PSISDataStatus NPfIT vocabulary. The possible values of the status (contained with the 'code' attribute) are: 1 - Event is normal 2 - Event has been withdrawn 3 - Event has been replaced NOTE: these were previously known as 'Normal', 'Nullified' and 'Replaced'.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:complexContent><xs:restriction base='hl7:CV'><xs:attribute name='code' use='required'><xs:simpleType><xs:restriction base='hl7:cs'><xs:enumeration value='1'/><xs:enumeration value='2'/><xs:enumeration value='3'/></xs:restriction></xs:simpleType></xs:attribute><xs:attribute name='codeSystem' type='hl7:uid' use='required'/><xs:attribute name='displayName' use='optional'><xs:simpleType><xs:restriction base='hl7:st'><xs:enumeration value='Normal'/><xs:enumeration value='Withdrawn'/><xs:enumeration value='Replaced'/></xs:restriction></xs:simpleType></xs:attribute></xs:restriction></xs:complexContent></xs:complexType><xs:complexType name='psisDate'><xs:annotation><xs:documentation>The psisDate type constrains the HL7 TS (timestamp) to use only its simplest form - a value attribute containing a date/time in the format yyyyMMddhhmmss.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation><xs:complexContent><xs:restriction base='hl7:TS'><xs:attribute name='value' use='required'><xs:simpleType><xs:restriction base='hl7:ts'><xs:pattern value='[0-9]{14,14}'/></xs:restriction></xs:simpleType></xs:attribute></xs:restriction></xs:complexContent></xs:complexType></xs:schema>
